title: Team Video Index view
custom_preconds:
Load new AtBat app on a device and load production/store version of AtBat on another device

https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/ANDROID-8483
custom_steps: Compare team video index view of 'old' version to 'new' version
custom_expected: The new version should present the same data as the old version

title: Time Zone Check
custom_preconds:
Settings > General > Time Zone


http://www.timezonecheck.com/

Use attached spreadsheet if needed.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your device to ET (NYC) and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar 
Team Page Schedule > List 
Scoreboard
MLB.TV EPG
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the data is displayed in the correct local time and time zone (ET). Also the data loads.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you set your device to CT (Chicago) and check the following:

Team Page Date Bar 
Team Page Game Detail
Team Page Schedule > Calendar 
Team Page Schedule > List 
Scoreboard
MLB.TV EPG
Gameday Audio Grid
News Article
Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the data is displayed in the correct local time and time zone (CT). Also the data loads.

Standings

Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the data is displayed in the correct local time and time zone (PT). Also the data loads.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navs to the MLB Network page via the slide out menu
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the schedule will load and be displayed in Eastern Time, regardless of the user's timezone

title: Upgrading App (Retaining Feature Access/Settings)
custom_preconds:
Given the user has the current Store build version installed from Google Play
And the user has logged in with an entitled account
And the user has set Favorite Team(s)
custom_steps:
When the user logs in to Google Play with a whitelisted account
And updates to the new version available in Alpha
And launches the app
custom_expected:
Then the user's login information will be retained
And the user's feature access will be retained
And the user's Favorite Teams will be retained

title: Handset - Video Launch Points
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed the app
and navigate to the areas of the app where video highlights are available
custom_steps: When the user attempts to play video from the following sections:

custom_steps_separated.content: Team Page carousel (handset only)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight opens and can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Team Page video index (handset only)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Videos section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: News Article (has an embedded video to lead it off)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Video token from a News Article (within the article as you scroll down)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight opens and can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Game Wrap
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Gameday Feed tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight opens and can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Gameday Videos section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight opens and can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Condensed Game or Game Recap
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight Condensed Game or Game Recap opens and can be watched in its entirety

title: Tablet - Video Launch Points
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed the app
and navigate to the areas of the app where video highlights are available
custom_steps: When the user attempts to play video from the following sections:

custom_steps_separated.content: Videos Tab (Live Gameday)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the embedded highlight will play and can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Gameday Feed tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight opens and can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Condensed Game or Game Recap
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight opens and can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: News Article (embedded video to lead it off)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the embedded highlight will play and can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Video token from a News Article (within the article as you scroll down)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the embedded highlight will play and can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Video section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight opens and can be watched in its entirety

title: In-App Purchase
custom_preconds:
Given the build has been uploaded to Google Alpha
and has been installed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the At Bat Yearly option
And purchases the subscription through the Play Store purchase flow
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the transaction is successful
And the user can dismiss the "Connect Purchase" screen
And the user will have At Bat access (Ex. Gameday Audio)
And the user will not see Lite ads

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the At Bat Monthly user then accesses the MLB.tv paywall
And purchases MLB.tv Monthly successfully
And then links to a BAMNET account on the "Connect Purchase" screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will have access to MLB.tv and Gameday Audio
And the user will not see Lite ads
And the BAMNET account will display both purchases and entitlements in the CS Tool

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user uninstalls the build
And reinstalls the build
And accesses a paywall
And taps the "Restore" button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user's purchases (At Bat Monthly and MLB.tv Monthly) will be restored
And the user can dismiss the "Connect Purchase" screen
And the user will have At Bat and MLB.tv access

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user installs the build on another device
And launches the app
And accesses a paywall
And logs in with their BAMNET account (FROM STEP 2)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will have access to At Bat and MLB.tv

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user uninstalls the build
And reinstalls the build
And the user taps the At Bat Monthly option
And purchases through the Play Store purchase flow
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the transaction is successful
And the user can link to their BAMNET account on the "Connect Purchase" screen
And the user will have At Bat access (Ex. Gameday Audio)
And the user will not see Lite ads

title: MLB.tv - Switching Feeds
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an Android device
custom_steps: When a user is watching an MLB.TV video

custom_steps_separated.content: and MLB.TV Premium user taps on a the other feed of the game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Media Framework check appears
and the user is let into the other feed

custom_steps_separated.content: and MLB.TV Premium user taps on a feed that is blacked out
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Media Framework check appears
and the blackout message appears

custom_steps_separated.content: and single team user taps on a the other feed of the game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Media Framework check appears
and the single team message appears restricting them from watching the feed

title: Chromecast
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat has been installed
and the user is on the same network as a Google Chromecast device

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the section header (e.g. Scoreboard, News, Team Page, Standings)
and taps on the Google Cast icon in the top right corner
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an overlay will display
AND all Chromecast devices found on the network will appear
AND all device names will display correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user selects an available Chromecast device
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Google Cast icon will show as enabled
AND it will now appear filled in with white

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the app is connected to a Chromecast device
and the user launches an MLB.TV feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the stream should launch on the Chromecast device
And the user should be taken to the video controller view on their handset

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the app is connected to a Chromecast device
and the user launches VOD content (video highlights, video in news article, Gameday video)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the VOD should launch on the Chromecast device
And the user should be taken to the video controller view on their handset

custom_steps_separated.content:
Verify player controls function while casting
(play/pause, mute, Closed Captioning, switching feeds)
custom_steps_separated.expected: The expected behavior should occur on the Chromecast device

title: 10 AM Scoreboard Flip
custom_preconds: Given the user is on an Android device with At Bat
custom_steps:
When the user opens At Bat
and taps on Scoreboard

custom_steps_separated.content: when the device date is current date before 10am
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Scoreboard will show the previous day's games

custom_steps_separated.content: when the device date is current date after 10am
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Scoreboard will show the current day's games

title: Lite User Gating
custom_preconds: Given a Lite user opens At Bat in Prod
custom_steps: Then the user should see the following when they perform the action

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on the Gameday Audio button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Sees an At Bat Paywall
with Monthly and Yearly options

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on MLB.TV button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Sees the MLB.TV EPG

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on a MLB.TV feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Sees a MLB.TV Paywall

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on Free Game of the Day from TV EPG
custom_steps_separated.expected: Sees Login screen with Free Game messaging

custom_steps_separated.content: Taps on Slide out Menu
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Sees an Buy At Bat upsell button
that launches the At Bat paywall

title: Data Updates
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is observing a live game
or a strung game in QA
custom_expected: Then the data will update accordingly

custom_steps_separated.content: on the Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Inning including States, Linescore including RHE, Count, Outs, Basepaths

custom_steps_separated.content: Scoreboard (collapsed)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Inning, Score, Count, Outs, Basepaths

custom_steps_separated.content: Scoreboard (expanded)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Inning (including States), Linescore including RHE, Count, Outs, Basepaths, Pitcher, Batter

custom_steps_separated.content: Tablet Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: RHE, Count, Outs, Pitcher, Batter, Inning (including States)

title: General App UX
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed on an iPad and iPhone
custom_steps: When a user has the app open

custom_steps_separated.content: swiping between games on the Team Page Schedule/Scores module
custom_steps_separated.expected: is smooth and no blinking and all data loads

custom_steps_separated.content: swiping vertically on the Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: is smooth and no blinking and all data loads

custom_steps_separated.content: swiping between games on the Scoreboard (collapsed)
custom_steps_separated.expected: is smooth and no blinking and all data loads

custom_steps_separated.content: swiping between games on the Scoreboard (expanded)
custom_steps_separated.expected: is smooth and no blinking and all data loads

custom_steps_separated.content: swiping vertically on the news index
custom_steps_separated.expected: is smooth and no blinking and all data loads

custom_steps_separated.content: swiping between news articles
custom_steps_separated.expected: is smooth and no blinking and all data loads

title: Location Permissions
custom_preconds:
Given the user has At Bat installed
on a device running OS 6.x or higher

custom_steps_separated.content:
Fresh install of At Bat
user selects Favorite team
custom_steps_separated.expected: User is asked for location permission upon landing on favorite team page

custom_steps_separated.content:
Fresh install of At Bat
user does not select Favorite team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
User is asked for location permission upon landing on Scoreboard page (if during season)
(or News Index during offseason)

custom_steps_separated.content:
User denies location permission
and then launches Audio EPG
custom_steps_separated.expected: User is asked for location permission again

custom_steps_separated.content:
User denies location permission
and then launches MLB.TV feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: User is asked for location permission again
